definition[0]: to tell someone angrily that you are annoyed with them or disapprove of them
example[0]: Mrs Watts will tick you off if you’re late again.
definition[1]: to mark the things on a list with a tick to show that they have been dealt with, chosen etc
example[1]: As you finish each task, tick it off.
example[2]: Have you ticked off Kate’s name on the list?
example[3]: Her attitude is really ticking me off.
definition[3]: to tell someone a list of things, especially when you touch a different finger as you say each thing on the list
example[4]: Carville began ticking off points on his fingers.
